battleships.logic

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleships.logic.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ai, Person

    public abstract class Player
extends Object
    Class contains methods for managing the players fleet and status.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player()
      Method constructs an implementation of the class and initialises variables.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Boolean addShip(Ship ship)
      Method adds the parameter Ship to the list of Ships and adds its location information to the map after making sure the Ship is valid.
      Boolean didPlayerLose()
      Method iterates through players Ships and checks if they have sunk.
      abstract void feedback(Boolean hit, Ship ship, int x, int y)
      Method receives the results of latest turn as parameters and updates the class variables accordingly.
      int[][] getEnemyMap()
      Method returns the array containing all the locations the player has guessed.
      Ship[][] getLocations()
      Method returns the array containing the locations of the players fleet.
      ShipValidator getPositionValidator()
      Method returns the positionValidator.
      ArrayList<Ship> getShips()
      Method returns a list containing the player fleet of Ships.
      void negateSurroundingAreaAfterSinking(Ship ship)
      Method automatically changes the values of squares on enemy map adjacent to a sunken ship to -1.
      void resetShips()
      Method removes all ships the player currently has.
      Ship shoot(int x, int y)
      Method compares the coordinates received as variables to the location map of player's fleet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Method constructs an implementation of the class and initialises variables.

    • Method Detail

      • feedback

        public abstract void feedback(Boolean hit,
                              Ship ship,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Method receives the results of latest turn as parameters and updates the class variables accordingly.
        Parameters:
        hit - True if the last coordinates returned contained an enemy ship
        ship - Contains the enemy ship that was sunk, otherwise null
        x - Contains the x coordinate that was last played
        y - Contains the y coordinate that was last played

      • shoot

        public Ship shoot(int x,
                  int y)
        Method compares the coordinates received as variables to the location map of player's fleet. If the locations contains a Ship the method will call the shoot method of that particular Ship.
        Parameters:
        x - Contains the x coordinate the opponent guessed
        y - Contains the y coordinate the opponent guessed
        Returns:
        Ship Object that was hit or null
        See Also:
        Ship.shot()

      • getShips

        public ArrayList<Ship> getShips()
        Method returns a list containing the player fleet of Ships.
        Returns:
        List of Ship Objects

      • getLocations

        public Ship[][] getLocations()
        Method returns the array containing the locations of the players fleet.
        Returns:
        Array of Ships showing the Ship locations

      • getEnemyMap

        public int[][] getEnemyMap()
        Method returns the array containing all the locations the player has guessed.
        Returns:
        Array of integers, marking the guessed locations

      • getPositionValidator

        public ShipValidator getPositionValidator()
        Method returns the positionValidator.
        Returns:
        positionValidator

      • didPlayerLose

        public Boolean didPlayerLose()
        Method iterates through players Ships and checks if they have sunk.
        Returns:
        True if all the Ships have sunk, otherwise false

      • addShip

        public Boolean addShip(Ship ship)
        Method adds the parameter Ship to the list of Ships and adds its location information to the map after making sure the Ship is valid.
        Parameters:
        ship - The ship intended to be added to the players fleet
        Returns:
        True if the ship was added, otherwise false

      • resetShips

        public void resetShips()
        Method removes all ships the player currently has.

      • negateSurroundingAreaAfterSinking

        public void negateSurroundingAreaAfterSinking(Ship ship)
        Method automatically changes the values of squares on enemy map adjacent to a sunken ship to -1.
        Parameters:
        ship - The sunken Ship
